intro: Trichopteryx kagerensis, commonly known as the Kager's featherleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features delicate, feathery leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrains. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trichopteryx kagerensis is considered a vulnerable species.
